infotrader.parser.writer

Class InfoTraderWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • infotrader.parser.writer.InfoTraderWriter

  • public class InfoTraderWriter
extends java.lang.Object

    A class for writing the gedcom structure out as a GEDCOM 5.5 compliant file.

    General usage is as follows:

    • Instantiate a GedcomWriter, passing the { InfoTrader} to be written as a parameter to the constructor.
    • Call one of the variants of the write method to write the data
    • Optionally check the contents of the { #validationFindings} collection to see if there was anything problematic found in your data.

    Validation

    By default, this class automatically validates your data prior to writing it by using a { infotrader.parser.validate.InfoTraderValidator}. This is to prevent writing data that does not conform to the spec.

    If validation finds any errors that are of severity ERROR, the writer will throw an Exception (usually { InfoTraderWriterVersionDataMismatchException} or { InfoTraderWriterException}). If this occurs, check the { #validationFindings} collection to determine what the problem was.

    Although validation is automatically performed, autorepair is turned off by default (see { org.gedcom4j.validate.GedcomValidator#setAutorepairEnabled(boolean)})...this way your data is not altered. Validation can be suppressed if you want by setting { #validationSuppressed} to true, but this is not recommended. You can also force autorepair on if you want.

      • write

        public void write(java.io.File file)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  InfoTraderWriterException
        Write the { InfoTrader} data as a GEDCOM 5.5 file. Automatically fills in the value for the FILE tag in the HEAD structure.
        Parameters:
        file - the { File} to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's a problem writing the data
        InfoTraderWriterException - if the data is malformed and cannot be written

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream out)
           throws InfoTraderWriterException
        Write the { InfoTrader} data in GEDCOM 5.5 format to an output stream
        Parameters:
        out - the output stream we're writing to
        Throws:
        InfoTraderWriterException - if the data is malformed and cannot be written; or if the data fails validation with one or more finding of severity ERROR (and validation is not suppressed - see { GedcomWriter#validationSuppressed})

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's a problem writing the data

      • emitLinesOfText

        protected void emitLinesOfText(int level,
                               java.lang.String startingTag,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> linesOfText)
        Convenience method for emitting lines of text when there is no xref, so you don't have to pass null all the time
        Parameters:
        level - the level we are starting at. Continuation lines will be one level deeper than this value
        startingTag - the tag to use for the first line of the text. All subsequent lines will be "CONT" lines.
        linesOfText - the lines of text

      • emitLinesOfText

        protected void emitLinesOfText(int level,
                               java.lang.String xref,
                               java.lang.String startingTag,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> linesOfText)
        Emit a multi-line text value. If a line of text contains line breaks (newlines, line feeds, carriage returns), the parts on either side of the line break will be treated as separate lines.
        Parameters:
        level - the level we are starting at. Continuation lines will be one level deeper than this value
        startingTag - the tag to use for the first line of the text. All subsequent lines will be "CONT" lines.
        xref - the xref of the item with lines of text
        linesOfText - the lines of text to write

      • emitStringsWithCustomTags

        protected void emitStringsWithCustomTags(int level,
                                         java.util.List<StringWithCustomTags> strings,
                                         java.lang.String tagValue)
                                  throws InfoTraderWriterException
        Emit a list of { StringWithCustomTags} objects, using a specific { Tag} value.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to write at
        strings - the list of strings to write (with custom tags)
        tagValue - the string value of the tag to use for each value in the collection
        Throws:
        InfoTraderWriterException - if the data cannot be written

      • emitTagWithOptionalValue

        Write a line and tag, with an optional value for the tag
        Parameters:
        level - the level within the file hierarchy
        tag - the tag for the line of the file
        value - the value to write to the right of the tag
        Throws:
        InfoTraderWriterException - if the value is null or blank (which never happens, because we check for it)
